name: St. Elizabeth of Hungary

locations.description: Queen of Hungary, then Franciscan tertiary

summary: Elizabeth of Hungary was a princess of the Kingdom of Hungary and Landgravine of Thuringia. After her husband's death, she became a Franciscan tertiary and dedicated her life to serving the poor and sick. She is known for her charity and is one of the most popular medieval saints. She is the patron saint of bakers, beggars, and the homeless.
